channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Britain's Most Dangerous Songs: Listen to the Banned
channel.desc: From `My Little Stick of Blackpool Rock' to `God Save the Queen', this is the story of ten records from the 1930s to the present day that have been banned by the BBC. The reasons why these songs were censored reveals the changing controversies around youth culture over the last 75 years, with Bing Crosby and the Munchkins among the unlikely names to have met the wrath of the BBC.
